input_text:
Job Title: Distribution Supervisor

Location: Fort Worth, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Distribution, Manufacturing

Description:
Adecco is hiring immediately for a Distribution Supervisor with a local client in Fort Worth, TX. Role is a direct hire opportunity. 
Duties:Distribution Supervisor is a key position within Warehouse Operations, with the responsibility to ensure the timely picking and distribution of customer sales orders while maintaining appropriate priority to schedule.role has responsibility for the leadership of all related training, staff, schedules, and equipment for the Distribution portion of Warehouse Operations.role is required to provide staffing supervision, scheduling, assure procedural compliance, safety, disciplinary actions as required and remain compliant with regulations and assure cost effective and timely deliveries.role works collaboratively with key business partners to ensure effective practices are implemented and clearly documented. Interacting with Customer Care, Commercial, Sales, Finance, Planning, and Operations to identify and meet business requirements.role also works closely with other global partners to ensure end-to-end supply chain execution and consistency in approach.staffing, schedules, and certifications of all distribution employees.maintenance and preventative maintenance programs for all related equipment and fixtures.with team to assure compliance to all related policies and procedures while driving best practice behavior and accountability as required.team execution of policies, programs, and objectives to ensure company’s success and a superior customer experience in all aspects of distribution.live loading and drop loading with Traffic team and fleet as required.and react timely to changes in strategy, business needs, or incidents assuring level leadership of all aspects of report.and assure all spaces within report have appropriate storage solutions, are well maintained, and meet all OSHA regulations including but not limited to signage, PPE, and safe passage.and maintain appropriate business continuity plans as identified or assigned.maintain and practice team development using empowerment, teaching to apply latest principals, concepts, practices and standards by using a variety of on-going projects, assignments, rewards, and recognition.lean-sigma, standard work and visual controls to standardize best practices within the warehouse and distribution center driving pride of ownership.replenishment strategies for all areas of report including direct ship lines for OEM customers.
Requirements:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required.8 years of hands-on warehouse experience in a combination of positions related to warehouse management, inventory management, and operations; minimum 2 years in related leadership position(s).Experience leading staff in a high volume “Just in time” environment.Proficient using and training Microsoft office suite, ERP, and other automation software and programs such as MES, TMS in a warehouse management environment.Ability and willingness to enforce procedural and policy compliance.Healthcare, medical device or other manufacturing in a regulated environment experience highly preferred.Results driven, innovative, creative, and action-oriented; able to align and energize teams behind common objectives in both a reporting and a non-reporting structure.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please visit http://www.adeccousa.com/candidate-privacy/. The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
Benefit offerings include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits and 401K plan. Our program provides employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. Available paid leave may include Paid Sick Leave, where required by law; any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law; and Holiday pay upon meeting eligibility criteria.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
